{"step_by_step_thinking": "Systemic Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis, also known as systemic-onset juvenile idiopathic arthritis, is characterized by several features including fever, rash, and hepatosplenomegaly as mentioned in documents [1], [2], and [7]. However, uveitis is not typically associated with the systemic form of the disease. It is more commonly seen in the pauciarticular onset type of juvenile rheumatoid arthritis as mentioned in document [1] and [3]. Therefore, the feature that is not typically associated with systemic Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis is uveitis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
